714388f-a.text: 145-149 West 72nd Street, north side, between Amsterdam and Columbus Avenues. About 1910.

717706f-a.text: Broadway to Amsterdam Avenue. (Before Reconstruction). December 11, 1918. President Borough of Manhattan.

717627f-b.text: Broadway, north from West 72nd Street, as photographed across the triangular park that is formed by its intersection with Amsterdam Avenue. Shown prominently is the ornate Ansonia, an apartment hotel that occupies the entire west frontage from 73rd to 74th Streets. This is detailed in View No. 2. The Central Savings Bank extends from 73rd to 74th Street's between the aforementioned thoroughfares. July 1930. March 1934. George L. Balgue.

714393f-a.text:
West 72nd Street, east from Amsterdam Ave. Note the station of the Sixth and Ninth Aves. Elevated Line, on Columbus Ave.
September 8, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
